intro: Microlonchus isernianus, commonly known as the Iberian spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the genus. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to Mediterranean climates.
